name: Prefer using shared error-page elements via web.xml to better control error handling
Prefer using JSP Standard Tag Library (JSTL) instead of JSP scriptlets as easier to read and to maintain
Ensure you review the Class design to reduce the number of Methods
Ensure you review the Class design to reduce the number of Constructors
Ensure that the classes have a resonable number of fields
Ensure that the interfaces have a reasonable number of methods
Ensure that you have access type defined at instance variable level to control accesss
Prefer using Protected or Private Instance Variables to control the accessibility
Ensure that Class Variables with Public Protected or Package access type are declared Final
Ensure explicitly Initializing the instance variable declared as final otherwise a compile-time error occurs.
Ensure that a getter and setter is provided for each private field
Ensure you declare the type as an interface of a more appropriate collection
Ensure you declare the type as an interface of a more appropriate collection.
Prefer not using 'java.io.File' to avoid violating the Enterprise JavaBeans (EJB) specification
Prefer using environment file instead of using java.lang.System.getenv()
Ensure you don't use 'java.lang.Runtime.exec()'
Ensure you don't use 'java.System.exit()' to know what happened when you exit your program
Ensure not using Fields (non static final) from other Classes to respect OO encapsulation concepts
Prefer using the exception error handling model instead of 'java.lang.Error'
Ensure you no longer use 'sun.*' Classes
Prefer not using anonymous Classes for maintenance reason
Ensure you don't use JNI for security reason
A clone method that is overridden in a subclass should call super.clone. Not doing so causes the subclass clone to return an object of the wrong type.
Prefer calling "super.finalize()" at the end of "Object.finalize()" implementations
Ensure that the boolean are not instantiated
Ensure that classes are not inheriting from java.lang.Throwable.
Ensure to throw an exception which has been declared
Ensure  let the system decide when it needs to collect the heap, and whether or not to do a full collection
Prefer using logging framework  as SLF4j instead of  'System.err' or 'System.out'
Ensure to have other ways of listing errors outside a try/catch  than 'System.err' and 'System.out'
Ensure to not use default stream(System.Err) for printStackTrace to print throwable and its stack trace in order to protect sensitive information.
Prefer using List and Map implementations instead of using Vector.
Prefer using HashMap instead of HashTable
Ensure to use class invocation or method call instead of dynamic instantiation known to be slower
Ensure that the class is implementing a reasonable number of Interfaces
Ensure that all classes that reference the database are in a specific layer usually called data layer
Ensure that EJB Entities are accessed through their local  Interface instead of their remote interface.
Ensure that EJB Session are accessed through their local remote Interface instead of their remote Interface
Ensure that action mappings have few forwards to avoid managing too complex behaviors in the Action class
Ensure that application architecture in not too complex and move some of this logic to another conceptual layer
Ensure to use the action mapping table in struts configuration file.
Ensure to have action classes that have only 1 public method
Ensure to reference only Java Objects belonging to the scope in order to respect the usage context in a JSP page.
Ensure that JSP Pages are accessed through their tiles definition
Prefer using PreparedStatement or CallableStatement over CreateStatement to prevent SQL Injection Attacks
Ensure to store global information in HttpSession, or use stateful session beans that are specifically targeted for this purpose
Ensure to use local variables inside your methods, and pass whatever data you need to other methods in the class via parameters
Ensure to use StringBuilder or StringBuffer and StringBuilder.append() or StringBuffer.append() method instead
Ensure to create a StringBuilder or StringBuffer before entering the loop
Ensure to have polymorphism over 'is' operator and downcasting
Ensure to not do object initialization inside a loop since it reduces performance
Ensure to remove unused and unnecessary Java imports
Ensure to have Action Class inherit from one single extension of Struts Action Class that is abstract or have an abstract method.
Ensure to initialize the String with the literal.
Ensure to add a try finally bloc
Ensure to make the inner class a standard class.
Ensure to make the inner class as standard class
Ensure to have the validation activated  for all Struts action mappings
Ensure to enable the Validator plugin declaration in your application's struts-config.xml file
Ensure to update the validation.xml's entries according to the form used in your application
Ensure to update the validation.xml's entries according to the form used in your application
Ensure to overrides equals() and hashCode()
Ensure to have the exact name and signature for each method and ensure having the '@Override' annotation when you need overriding a method declared in a superclass (for JSE 5.0 or later)
Prefer not using this within Constructor in multi-thread environment to avoid unpredictable behavior
Prefer not using Double checked locking for JSE 4.x and previous version
Ensure to use a lazy fetching strategy when the table contains lot of rows
Ensure to use  lists, maps, bags, idbags and sets depending on your case to map a collection instead of using array to Map Collection
Ensure that equals() and hashCode() are defined for component as they do not have an identifier property
Ensure that static Field of type collection are not used
Ensure to use version attribute instead of timestamp for Hibernate Entity
Prefer using container's resource management facilities to obtain connections to resources instead of using DriverManager class allowing direct connection to the database
An exception should be correctly handled according to its type and not by using an assertion
Ensure not explicitly invoking the finalize() method.
Ensure that exceptions  throwed in a catch block  are cached
Prefer using SAX parser for large or medium sized XML file parsing instead of DOM parser
Prefer using SLF4J that acts as a facade for different logging frameworks instead of using basic java log files
Ensure that session.setFlushMode(FlushMode.COMMIT, FlushMode.NEVER or FlushMode.MANUAL)  is not used
Prefer not using auto-wiring to guarantee more flexibility and better performance of your application
Ensure not using/defining singleton or factory for Spring Based application
Ensure reducing the number of EJB beans to hold performance and complexity of the application
Ensure validating all inputs in JSP files that use JSF
Ensure that debug method invocation is usually preceded by a call to its corresponding isDebugEnabled method
Ensure your application does not execute HTTP requests without sanitization
Ensure you don't unsanitized queries to SQL databases
Ensure your application does not run LDAP methods without sanitization
Ensure your application does not run OS commande without sanitization
Ensure your application properly neutralize XML content before it is processed
Ensure you do file path manipulation without including untrusted data
Ensure you provide enough comment for your Classes
Avoid empty finally blocks
Avoid Artifacts with lines longer than X characters
Avoid empty catch blocks
Avoid Classes with a High Number Of Children
Avoid Classes with a High Public Data Ratio
Ensure you have a good level of comments of your Functions
Always Subclass Exception and throw the subclassed Classes, do not throw the exception Exception.
Add comments into functions to explain what is their goal and how they work.
Add comments into method implementation to explain what is their goal and how they work.
Avoid large Artifacts - too many Lines of Code
Avoid undocumented Classes
Ensure your methods are commented enough to provide good understanding to other contributors
Ensure you catch subclass of Exception, RuntimeException or Throwable
Ensure not using jump statements inside a finally block so that any RuntimeException could be propagated and not discarded
Prefer using stored procedure instead of using direct SQL queries to database
Ensure your JSP/ASP pages are not directly connected to database
Ensure that finalize() is not used as the time of execution is not garanteed
Ensure defining a business method for removing the Stateful bean instance and call it from the client side
Ensure you have a number of local methods and remote methods called by methods in the Class below a predefined threshold
Ensure that unsecured EJB remote method are not used as they lead to security weakness
Ensure you don't overwrite member of a class in its subclass.
Ensure you don't forget the default clause in your switch statement
Ensure you don't use multiple break statement in 'for' loops
Ensure that Struts 2 Validator field not referencing a java class field is not used as it leads to security weakness
Ensure all defined validation forms are used
Ensure when you build a log that accepts a format string as an argument, the argument has been sanitized when it originates from an external source.
Ensure that testing floating point numbers for equality is not used as is source of imprecision
Ensure when you use a function that accepts a format string as an argument, the argument has been sanitized when it originates from an external source.
Ensure setting timeouts for blocking synchronous calls to prevent an infinite waiting time
Ensure not having hard-coded network resources names in the source files (JEE)
Ensure you have released your SQL connection after an effective lifetime
Ensure you have released your stream connection after an effective lifetime
Ensure using dedicated stored procedures when multiple data accesses are needed
Ensure data handling operations are properly encapsulated to provide clear status of the execution
Ensure to have CDI Beans with normal scope proxyable
Ensure not using expired or released database resource to prevent access to sensitive data that is associated with a different user or entity.
Ensure not using incorrect numeric type conversions to avoid data corruption
Always check the content type when receiving a HTTP post
Prefer not using deprecated methods, constructors, fields, type or packages
Ensure you don't have hard-coded credentials in your source code because it could be retro-engineered by attackers.
Avoid mixing trusted and untrusted data in HTTP requests
Ensure you have secured your cookie by enabling 'Secure' attribute
Ensure using sufficient random values for cookies

Ensure you don't use user input without validation

Ensure you don't use weak cryptographic hash one-way reversible

Ensure your application does not evaluate unsanitized code.
Ensure you have sanitized the data received to be reflected in your application

Ensure you have sanitized the methods manipulating resources

Ensure you do file path manipulation without including untrusted data
Ensure when you build a log that accepts a format string as an argument, the argument has been sanitized when it originates from an external source.
Ensure when you use a function that accepts a format string as an argument, the argument has been sanitized when it originates from an external source.

Ensure you use sanitized queries to NoSQL databases
Ensure your application does not redirect to an untrusted site

Avoid deserialization injection through API requests
Ensure to use an advanced encryption algorithm and prefer avoiding DES, 3DES
Ensure to use Optimal Asymmetric Encryption Padding(OAEP) scheme with RSA encryption to avoid sensitive information exposure.
Ensure you are not using deprecated SSL protocols to secure your connection
Ensure not relying on the session ID provided by "request.getRequestedSessionId()"
Ensure that you are not using predictable SecureRandom Seeds
Ensure to manage an exception in servlet method using a try catch block to prevent exposing system vulnerabilities
Ensure not using deprecated cryptographic hash otherwise it could be broken by hackers (JEE)
Ensure you are not using "referer" header field in HTTP request
Prefer using cipher including Hash based Message Authentication Code (HMAC) to ensure data integrity
Ensure that HTTP request redirections are not performed with user provided data
Ensure that Hard-coded salt is not used with cryptography function so that sensitive data is protected
Ensure to not use "javax.crypto.NullCipher" for anything other than testing
Prefer using long PBE Iteration Count to to decrease attack possibilities
Ensure using only secured cookie to avoid Cross-site scripting attacks (JEE)
Always enable HttpOnly when creating cookies to avoid Cross-site scripting attacks
Perefer using encryption providing sufficient key size to ensure enough entropy against attacks
Prefer using SystemDefaultHttpClient Constructor to ensure better transport layer security
Ensure to preceed the call of DocumentBuilder by a call to the secure mode of the parser
Ensure to preceed the call of SAXParserFactory by a call to the secure mode of the parser
Ensure to preceed the call of XMLReader by a call to the secure mode of the parser
Ensure to preceed the call of XPathFactory by a call to the secure mode of the parser
Ensure to preceed the call of XMLStreamReader by a call to the secure mode of the parser
BannedAPI should not be used because they are considered deprecated and unsafe
Ensure using {@code} to wrap code statements
Prefer using @Override annotation to mark methods overriding or implementing a method declared in a super type to avoid unintentional errors
Always set an expiration time for an Http Session to improve security
Always make sure to use a Yaml instance that is constructed either with a SafeConstructor.
Ensure the cookie id are always generate with a sufficient random algorithm like SecureRandom
Ensure the readObject() has been implemented for class instantiated by ObjectInputStream to prevent untrusted deserialization
Ensure you do not allow access to all domain when defining cookie domain (JEE)
Ensure to declare the object as serializable if you are using it as a httpsession attribute
Prefer using java.net.URI instead of java.net.URL
jYAML project is abandonned and muts not be used to deserialize YAML
Ensure you have enable CSRF Protection in your spring security project.
Ensure activating Content-Security-Policy for Spring application to avoid untrusted source
Ensure declaring formLogin after requesting authorization and authentication
Ensure cleaning the cookies during the logout to avoid them to be used by another web application
Ensure invalidating HTTP Session during logout to avoid broken Authentication
Ensure specifying "PermitAll" or "user role" for URL(s) access to enforce security
Ensure safely set X-Frame-Option  to avoid Clickjacking attack
Ensure securing Shutdown Actuator Endpoint from unauthenticated access.
Ensure explicitly specifying single HTTP method in @RequestMapping methods to avoid information leakage
Prefer not using Generic Authentication Exception Class to promote easy error handling
Ensure not using ControllerAdvice And HandlerExceptionResolver simultaneously to avoid unexpected behavior
Ensure not using the same name for multiple validation forms to avoid any validation error.
Ensure excluding class parameter for ParametersInterceptor when using Struts 2.3.16 (and older)
Ensure to not have Unused Validation Form in Struts 1.x to correctly maintain the validation logic
Ensure to enable validation for each Struts action Mapping of your application to prevent any types of attacks.
Ensure to have Struts action pointing to a an existent form-bean in Struts 1.x to avoid mapping error
Ensure not using wildcard for cookiesName param configuration in CookieInterceptor with Struts 2.3.16 (and Older). This allow preventing Injection attack.
Ensure activating tags for escaping string in order to sanitize user input and prevent XSS attacks
Ensure note using wildcards for action mapping name to avoid executing arbitrary Java code on server side
configured without namespace or with wildcard namespace is vulnerable to remote code execution attack
Ensure not using excludeParams for Struts 2.3.20 ( and older) to avoid
Prefer using short request parameter name to prevent the DOS attack
Ensure you are using Struts URLValidator with at least version 2.5.13 or 2.3.34
Using invoking dataHandler.createXStream method with type filtering to Remote Code Execution when deserializing XML payloads
Using Dynamic Method Invocation for Apache Struts 2.x allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via method: prefix, related to chained expressions.
Ensure you have upgraded your Struts framework 2.3.24.1 and above if you use special top object
Ensure not using JSON-lib library for Rest Plugin of Struts 2.5 to 2.5.14
Ensure using ANSI standard Operators such as <>,<=,>= in SQL where clauses to ensure portability
Ensure to not use explain() method in production code so that performance is not reduced
Avoid having multiple Artifacts updating data on the same NoSQL Collection (JEE)
Avoid having multiple Artifacts inserting data on the same NoSQL Collection (JEE)
Avoid having multiple artifacts deleting data on the same NoSQL collections (JEE)
Prefer using MyBatis query statementto prevent SQL Injection Attacks
